aa3247d0-9c5d-426b-9cb0-d8bf262304ac.description: Members who hold a valid certification accepted by RID, are in good standing, and meet the requirements of the Certification Maintenance Program (CMP).
aa3247d0-9c5d-426b-9cb0-d8bf262304ac.name: Certified

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Holds a valid RID credential
Member pays the required annual dues
Adheres to the RID Code of Professional Conduct

2f1e7abc-96c5-4150-b7d5-695ac6bc09fc.description: Holders of this certification have demonstrated general knowledge in the field of interpreting, ethical decision making and interpreting skills. Candidates earn the NIC if they demonstrate professional knowledge and skills that meet or exceed the minimum professional standards necessary to perform in a broad range of interpretation and transliteration assignments. This credential has been available since 2005.
2f1e7abc-96c5-4150-b7d5-695ac6bc09fc.name: National Interpreter Certification (NIC)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Apply for the NIC Knowledge Exam
Pass the NIC Knowledge Exam
Submit proof of meeting the educational requirement to RID
Apply for the NIC Interview and Performance Exam
Pass the NIC Interview and Performance Exam

879a404f-5b94-4299-9036-d355da315982.description: Holders of this certification are recognized as fully certified in interpretation and have demonstrated the ability to interpret between American Sign Language (ASL) and spoken English for both sign-to-voice and voice-to-sign tasks. Additionally, the ability to transliterate between English-based sign language and spoken English for both sign-to-voice and voice-to-sign tasks. Holders of the CI and CT are recommended for a broad range of transliteration and interpreting assignments.
879a404f-5b94-4299-9036-d355da315982.name: Certificate of Interpretation (CI) and Certificate of Transliteration (CT)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Passed written and performance exams

22ae3a15-bb5b-4e85-8837-fd0f31fe26d3.description: Member engaged in interpreting or transliterating, full-time and part-time, but not holding certification accepted by RID. Members in this category are enrolled in the Associate Continuing Education Tracking Program (ACET).
22ae3a15-bb5b-4e85-8837-fd0f31fe26d3.name: Associate Member

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Member pays the required annual dues.
Agree to adhere to the RID code of ethics

6e33b9af-2b43-4ce1-a9a5-b578af056f91.description: Holders of this certification demonstrated the ability to interpret/transliterate classroom content and discourse between students who are deaf/ hard of hearing and students, teachers and school staff who are hearing. Certificants demonstrated EIPA Level 4* skills using spoken English and at least one of the following visual languages, constructs, or symbol systems at either an elementary or secondary level: American Sign Language (ASL) Manually Coded English (MCE) Contact Signing or Cued Speech
6e33b9af-2b43-4ce1-a9a5-b578af056f91.name: Educational Certificate: K-12 (Ed:K-12)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Passed the EIPA assessment through Boys Town.
Submited proof of meeting BA or equivalent educational requirement to RID

3f981b28-598e-4665-aa19-800cf3904a7a.description: Individuals who achieved the NIC Advanced level have passed the NIC Knowledge Exam, scored within the standard range of a professional interpreter on the interview portion of the NIC Interview and Performance Exam and scored within the high range on the performance portion of the NIC Interview and Performance Exam. The NIC with levels credential was offered from 2005 to November 30, 2011.
3f981b28-598e-4665-aa19-800cf3904a7a.name: National Interpreter Certification- Advanced (NIC Advanced)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

Passed the NIC Knowledge Exam
Submitted proof of meeting the educational requirement to RID
Applied for the NIC Interview and Performance Exam
Passed the NIC Interview and Performance Exam

c0ff98b5-6fd9-4838-9aa5-280c94a76ec0.description: Holders of this certification are recognized as fully certified in transliteration and have demonstrated the ability to transliterate between English-based sign language and spoken English for both sign-to-voice and voice-to-sign tasks. The transliterator’s ability to interpret is not considered in this certification. Holders of the CT are recommended for a broad range of transliteration assignments. This credential was offered from 1988 to 2008.
c0ff98b5-6fd9-4838-9aa5-280c94a76ec0.name: Certificate of Transliteration (CT)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

ec54ecc3-0937-45c6-84d3-68ed667ec09d.description: Holders of this certification are recognized as fully certified in interpretation and have demonstrated the ability to interpret between American Sign Language (ASL) and spoken English for both sign-to-voice and voice-to-sign tasks. The interpreter’s ability to transliterate is not considered in this certification. Holders of the CI are recommended for a broad range of interpretation assignments. This credential was offered from 1988 to 2008.
ec54ecc3-0937-45c6-84d3-68ed667ec09d.name: Certificate of Interpretation (CI)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

48b28bd9-5952-4b53-b445-0682de212765.description: This credential is fully recognized by RID, but the designation is no longer awarded by RID. This designation went into moratorium effective January 1, 2016.Description: Holders of this specialist certification demonstrated specialized knowledge of legal settings and greater familiarity with language used in the legal system. These individuals are recommended for a broad range of assignments in the legal setting. This credential was offered from 1998 to 2016.
48b28bd9-5952-4b53-b445-0682de212765.name: Specialist Certificate: Legal (SC:L)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Held RID Certification
Documentation of a number of hours of legal interpreting experience and/or being mentored in the legal setting plus a number of hours of formal legal training.
Passed the SC:L written and performance exams

74a16232-a521-4548-a4c8-7790a4cc1715.description: Holders of this certification possess excellent voice-to-sign skills and above average sign-to-voice skills. Holders have demonstrated above average skill in any given area. Performance is consistent and accurate and fluency is smooth, with few deletions; the viewer has no question to the candidate’s competency. Holders of this certification should be able to interpret in most situations.
74a16232-a521-4548-a4c8-7790a4cc1715.name: National Association of the Deaf- IV (NAD IV)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Passed the NAD exam
Registered with RID prior to June 30, 2005.

7200dead-f488-461b-a899-6e07aa29038d.description: Holders of this certification have demonstrated the ability to interpret between American Sign Language (ASL) and spoken English and to transliterate between spoken English and an English-based sign language. Holders of this certification are recommended for a broad range of interpreting and transliterating assignments. This credential was offered from 1972 to 1988.
7200dead-f488-461b-a899-6e07aa29038d.name: Comprehensive Skills Certificate (CSC)

112fb66d-9d91-4e3b-8c2d-7c9dacbf8f7e.description: Individuals who achieved the NIC Master level have passed the NIC Knowledge Exam and scored within the high range on both portions of NIC Interview and Performance Exam.The NIC with levels credential was offered from 2005 to November 30, 2011.
112fb66d-9d91-4e3b-8c2d-7c9dacbf8f7e.name: National Interpreter Certification- Master (NIC Master)

56ff0443-99e4-4fd1-ad64-2c098c720311.description: Holders of this certification possess above average voice-to-sign skills and good sign-to-voice skills. Holders have demonstrated the minimum competence needed to meet generally accepted interpreter standard. Occasional words or phrases may be deleted but the expressed concept is accurate. The individual displays good grammar control of the second language and is generally accurate and consistent, but is not qualified for all situations.
56ff0443-99e4-4fd1-ad64-2c098c720311.name: National Association of the Deaf- III (NAD III)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

740b0c7a-9e95-4818-ad88-a6f18325b6b7.description: Holders of this certification possess superior voice-to-sign skills and excellent sign-to-voice skills. Holders have demonstrated excellent to outstanding ability in any given area. The individual had minimum flaws in their performance and have demonstrated interpreting skills necessary in almost all situations.
740b0c7a-9e95-4818-ad88-a6f18325b6b7.name: National Association of the Deaf- V (NAD-V)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

Registered with RID prior to June 30, 2005.

0358bf9e-3a08-43c2-b85e-96fca6643e22.description: Holders of this certification have demonstrated the ability to interpret between American Sign Language (ASL) and spoken English and also demonstrated the ability to transliterate between spoken English and a signed code for English. Holders of the IC/TC are recommended for a broad range of interpretation and tranliteration assignments.
0358bf9e-3a08-43c2-b85e-96fca6643e22.name: Interpretation Certificate (IC)/ Transliteration Certificate (TC)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Passed the CSC exam at a certain level.

373ca954-e546-4061-a786-12960f3f9dd5.description: This credential is fully recognized by RID, but no longer awarded by RID. Holders of this certification demonstrated, using silent oral techniques and natural gestures and the ability to transliterate a spoken message from a person who hears to a person who is deaf or hard-of-hearing. Holders also demonstrated the ability to understand and repeat the message and intent of the speech and mouth movements of the person who is deaf or hard-of-hearing. This credential was offered from 1999 to 2016.
373ca954-e546-4061-a786-12960f3f9dd5.name: Oral Transliteration Certificate (OTC)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Documented a number of educational hours specifically in the area of oral transliterating, and a number of hours of experience (supervised or unsupervised) in oral transliterating.
Passed OTC written and performance exams

4d3de4b8-1559-4fb9-ad3e-365feea7eac3.description: Holders of this conditional permit had completed an RID-recognized training program designed for interpreters and transliterators who worked in legal settings, and whom were also deaf or hard-of-hearing. Holders of this conditional permit were recommended for a broad range of assignments in the legal setting. This credential was available from 1991 to 2016.
4d3de4b8-1559-4fb9-ad3e-365feea7eac3.name: Conditional Legal Interpreting Permit-Relay (CLIP-R)

c0e14d28-6d6e-4a2c-a448-baa3fa5ed3b8.description: Holders of the RSC have demonstrated the ability to interpret between ASL and English-based sign language or transliterate between spoken English and a signed English. Interpretation/transliteration is rendered in ASL, spoken English and a signed code for English or written English. Holders of the RSC are recommended for a broad range of assignments. This credential was offered from 1972 to 1988.

This credential was offered until 1988.

d18dd66f-a288-4f8d-af68-a77b493476e3.description: The Provisional Deaf Interpreter Credential [PDIC] is a temporary credential that was awarded to eligible individuals who satisfied all previous requirements for taking the CDI performance test, AND ALSO who submitted the required application form, approved attestations of language and interpreting competence, and application fee.
d18dd66f-a288-4f8d-af68-a77b493476e3.name: Provisional Deaf Interpreter Credential (PDIC)

issuer.summary: issued by Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

entity.name: Registry of Interpreters for the Deaf

badge_template_activities.title: Submitted PDIC application and associated documents [evidence of passing score on the CDI written exam, degree transcript of approval letter for the Alternative Pathway]

Confirmed that attesters have submitted the required attestations of skill sets to RID through. There are eight [8] attestations total that must be submitted. Two [2] affirming your ability to adequately provide sight/text translation. Two [2] affirming your ability to adequately provide simultaneous interpretation. Two [2] affirming your ability to adequately provide consecutive interpretation. Two [2] affirming your ability to adequately provide mirror/platform Interpreting

c7fd26d9-46d7-4438-963a-05b624160497.description: Holders of this certification demonstrated the ability to transliterate a spoken message from a person who hears to a person who is deaf or hard-of-hearing.
